forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely after 10am. Partly sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. South wind 2 to 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Light Rain Likely then Partly Cloudy
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely before 10pm. Partly cloudy, with a low around 48. West northwest wind 10 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco this morning, the day unfurls under a tapestry of clouds, lending the sky a moody depth that hints at rain later on. As the hours pass, expect the weather to shift, with showers likely creeping in after ten o'clock, bringing along the familiar chill that characterizes this season. The temperature is set to hover around fifty-nine degrees, easing down a notch as afternoon approaches, while a gentle southerly breeze whispers through the streets at a mild pace.

Though the city may appear partially sunny at this hour, a dense marine layer can be detected on the horizon, shrouding the Golden Gate Bridge and casting a soft veil over the landscape. Such conditions lend a romantic haze to the eyes, perfect for contemplative walks along the coastline, even as the chance of rain lingers in the air. Dressing in layers, with a light jacket to fend off the cooling breeze and perhaps a prepared umbrella, would serve well for those heading outdoors. It's a day well-suited for leisurely activities: perhaps visiting a local café to savor a warm drink or perusing the many art galleries that enliven the area, all while enjoying the evolving moods of the city beneath the shifting clouds.
